definition: to convert/to turn into (sth else)/to adapt (a story to another medium)
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: The original resteruant has been changed to a tea house now.
sentences.chinese: 還有，原來喫包子的地方現在改成茶室了。

sentences.english: The local cinema has been made into a bingo hall .
sentences.chinese: 當地的電影院已被改成賓果遊戲廳了。
那條路已改成了雙車道。

sentences.english: To transliterate from a published work into Braille for publication.
sentences.chinese: 將已經發表的作品改成盲文出版。

sentences.english: A few who run shops have turned their storefronts into missing person displays.
sentences.chinese: 有些開店的人乾脆把門面改成了失蹤人口展覽。

sentences.english: Its cylinder was just an old piece of gas-pipe.
sentences.chinese: 這臺引擎的汽缸是用一截煤氣管改成的。

sentences.english: But the merry men preferred to call him Little John .
sentences.chinese: 但羅賓漢一夥把他的姓和名顛倒過來，改成了小約翰。

sentences.english: Office facilities is made up change mechanism administration to make up general need to attend officeholder exam.
sentences.chinese: 機關事業編改成機關行政編一般需要參加公務員考試。

sentences.english: Please change this penetrating piece into watertight construction.
sentences.chinese: 請將這個穿艙件改成水密的。

sentences.english: The windows are made of glass and there is no need to use paper or linens anymore.
sentences.chinese: 窗子改成玻璃的，也用不着再糊上紙或紗。

sentences.english: How about if we go tomorrow instead?
sentences.chinese: 我們改成明天未來誥日去怎麼樣？

sentences.english: There is no coffee. Woule you like a cup of tea instead?
sentences.chinese: 沒有咖啡了。你要不要改成喝茶？

sentences.english: The basement has been made over into a playroom.
This house has a basement which is converted to a warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 這個房子有個地下室，被改成了倉庫。

sentences.english: Can you turn the declarative sentence into a rhetorical question?
sentences.chinese: 你能把這個陳述句改成反問句嗎？

sentences.english: The monthly magazine will be changed to a daily publication next year.
sentences.chinese: 這份月刊從明年開始就要改成日刊了。

definition: to exchange (sth) for (sth else)/to replace with/to convert into
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
originally/original/former
to get rid of/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to delete/to strip out/to extract
to renew/to reform
to change into/to turn into/to become
originally/original
original/former/originally/formerly/at first/so, actually, as it turns out
to change (sth)/to alter (sth)/to change over (to sth else)
to amend/to alter/to modify
to alter/to modify/to revise
to cut/to throw out/to depose (from office)/to tear off
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to replace/to take the place of
straightforward/clear-cut/blunt (e.g. statement)/you might as well/simply
to exchange/to replace/to substitute for/to switch
